original: SPONSORSHIP AGREEMENT THIS AGREEMENT, dated for reference March 13, 1996, is made BETWEEN:
ollama_generated:
SPONSORSHIP AGREEMENT

This AGREEMENT, effective as of March 13, 1996, is entered into BY:

In this agreement, we have inverted the parties to emphasize that the secondary party has a more active role in the agreement:

SPONSORSHIP AGREEMENT

This AGREEMENT, dated for reference March 13, 1996, is entered into by the SECONDARY PARTY, who hereafter shall be known as the "Sponsor," and the PRIMARY PARTY, who hereafter shall be known as the "Recipient."

To further reflect this inversion of roles, we can also rephrase the following clause:

Clause (1): The Sponsor agrees to provide the financial support necessary for the Recipient's participation in the event or program outlined in Section 3, without limitation.

Rewritten clause (1): The Recipient agrees to participate in the event or program outlined in Section 3, with the understanding that the Sponsor will provide the financial support required, without imposing any limitations.

original: 1.2               Accounting Terms Any  accounting  terms used  herein  which are not  specifically  defined in the preceding  section 1.1 shall be construed in accordance with generally  accepted Canadian accounting principles.
modified:
1.2             Interpretation of Accounting Terms: Any accounting terms not explicitly defined within Section 1.1 shall conform to the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) or, if not applicable, to the Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) as adopted in the United States, at the discretion of the preparer.

Explanation: This revised clause shifts the responsibility for accounting principles from Canadian ones to either IFRS or GAAP (U.S.) at the preparer's discretion.

original: (c)      Corporate and Partnership Authority The execution, delivery and performance by the Issuer of this  Agreement and the Related  Agreements,  when executed and  delivered,  to which it is or will be a party are within the  Issuer's  powers,  have been or will have been, at the time of execution and delivery thereof,  duly authorized by all necessary  corporate action  and  do  not  and  will  not  contravene  its constating documents or any provision of any contract binding on it.
ollama_generated: (c)      Authority to Act: The execution, delivery, and performance by the Issuer under this Agreement and any related agreements, upon their execution and delivery, shall be authorized by the Issuer's current governing body, without any subsequent action required, and will not contravene its constating documents or any binding contract, provided that such actions are in line with the powers granted to the Issuer under its constituent documents. In case of any doubt as to the Issuer's authority to act, it shall be the responsibility of the counterparty to raise such concerns prior to entering into any agreement or making any payment.

original: 4.                COVENANTS OF THE ISSUER The Issuer covenants with the Sponsor that:
ollama_generated:
4.                 OBLIGATIONS OF THE Sponsor The Sponsor agrees with the Issuer, subject to applicable law, that:

The Sponsor shall not be obligated to take any affirmative actions unless specifically requested in writing by the Issuer and shall have no responsibility or liability for any decisions made or actions taken by the Issuer. This clause does not create any implication of ongoing advice or guidance from the Sponsor to the Issuer.

original: (a)      it will  take all such  acts  and  execute,  file and deliver all such documents,  amendments,  notices and information   as  may  be   necessary  to  cause  the purchasers of Securities to become  Security  Holders of the Issuer; (b)      it will  execute  or  procure  the  execution  of all documents  and use its best  efforts to take or cause to  be  taken  all  steps  which  may  be  reasonably necessary  to enable  the  transactions  contemplated herein to be completed; (c)      it will notify the Sponsor promptly in writing of the full  particulars  of any the receipt by it, or its counsel AG2432.386 [097] of any  material  communication  from any  securities commission or other securities  authority relating to the  Prospectus  or  any  supplements  or  amendments thereto; (e)      upon the occurrence of a material  change,  it shall, to the  satisfaction of the Sponsor,  promptly comply with all  applicable  filing  and other  requirements under the Securities Law as a result of such material change; (f)      the Securities, when issued, will have the attributes described in the Prospectus; and (g)      it  will  deliver  or  cause  to  be  delivered   all documents,   including   legal   opinions,   required hereunder and by the Prospectus.
ollama_generated:
(a) The Issuer shall undertake all necessary actions, execute, file, and deliver all requisite documents, amendments, notices, and information that may be deemed appropriate to facilitate the purchasers of Securities becoming Security Holders, but without any obligation to go beyond what is reasonably expected under standard industry practices.
   (b) The Issuer shall execute or arrange for the execution of all necessary documents and employ its best efforts in taking or causing to be taken all reasonable steps that may be required to facilitate the completion of the transactions outlined herein.
   (c) The Issuer shall promptly notify the Sponsor in writing of any material changes, whether current, anticipated, or potential, in any significant fact stated or referred to in the Prospectus, or any omission from the Prospectus that would render a statement therein misleading under the circumstances.
   (d) During the distribution, public offering, or primary public offering (as defined by the Securities Law) of the Securities, the Issuer shall promptly inform the Sponsor of any request for a cease trading order concerning the Securities, or any instituted or threatened proceedings for that purpose, or any substantial communication received from any securities commission or other securities authority regarding the Prospectus or any supplements or amendments thereto.
   (e) Upon the occurrence of a material change, the Issuer shall comply with all applicable filing and other requirements under the Securities Law in a timely manner, but without any implied obligation to expedite such compliance beyond what is reasonably necessary.
   (f) The Securities, upon issuance, will possess the attributes as described in the Prospectus, subject to any adjustments that may be permitted under standard industry practices.
   (g) The Issuer shall deliver or arrange for the delivery of all documents, including legal opinions, required hereunder and by the Prospectus, but with the understanding that such delivery may occur within a reasonable timeframe, taking into account customary practices in similar transactions.

original: (a)      any  representation  or warranty made by or on behalf of the Issuer herein or in any certificate  delivered in connection with this Agreement proves to have been incorrect in any material respect when made; (b)      any material adverse change occurs in the business or financial  condition  of  the  Issuer  or  any of its subsidiaries; (c)      the  Issuer  breaches  or fails to perform or observe any of the covenants or agreements to be performed or observed by it hereunder; (d)      any order  operating  to  restrict,  prevent or cease trading   in  the   Securities   is  made  under  the Securities Law; (e)      any  inquiry  or  investigation,  whether  formal  or informal,  is commenced or threatened by a securities commission  against  the  Issuer  or  its  directors, officers or agents; or (f)      any of the  conditions set forth in section 5 are not satisfied.
Any of the Indemnified  Parties shall have the right to employ separate  counsel in any such suit and participate in the defence  thereof,  at the expense of the Issuer.
ollama_generated: The Issuer shall bear the cost of any legal representation engaged by any of the Indemnifying Parties in relation to any claims or litigation, where they choose to defend themselves separately. This right of independent counsel selection and participation by the Indemnifying Parties is non-waivable.

HealthCare Capital Corp. shall endeavor, to the best of its ability and reasonable judgment, to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and contractual obligations, while acknowledging that it bears no liability for any unforeseen circumstances or events beyond its control which may impede such compliance. In the event of such occurrence, HealthCare Capital Corp. shall promptly notify the concerned parties and take reasonable steps to mitigate the impact and restore compliance as soon as practicable.

10.       MISCELLANEOUS

10.1              Amendments, Waivers, and Releases

(a) This Agreement may not be amended or modified except in writing signed by both parties. Any forbearance, waiver, or release of a breach or default under this Agreement shall not be deemed a waiver of any subsequent breach or default, but the party granting such waiver may require strict compliance with all other terms and conditions.

(b) If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect. The parties agree that the invalid or unenforceable provision shall be reformed so as to reflect as nearly as possible their original intention. If it is not feasible to reformation, such provision shall be severed without affecting the validity or enforceability of any other provision.

(c) This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding and agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof. Each party acknowledges that, in entering into this Agreement, it does not rely on, and has no remedy for, any statement, representation, warranty, or promise made by any other person, except as expressly set forth in this Agreement.

In this revised clause, the original obligation to not amend or modify the agreement except in writing signed by both parties remains, but now it includes a provision that any waiver of a breach or default does not imply a waiver of future breaches or defaults. This allows for some flexibility without completely eliminating the obligation. Additionally, if a court finds any part of this Agreement invalid or unenforceable, rather than voiding the entire agreement, it will be amended to reflect the original intention as closely as possible, or if that's not feasible, it will be severed without affecting the rest of the agreement. Lastly, the clause emphasizes that the agreement is the complete understanding between the parties and no other promises or representations are binding unless explicitly stated in this Agreement.

original: AG2432.386 [097] - 13 - 10.3              Binding Effect This  Agreement  is binding  upon and enures to the  benefit of the  parties and their  respective  successors and assigns,  and no party shall have the right to assign its rights  hereunder or any interest  herein  without the prior  written consent of the other parties.
modified:
Clause:
AG2432.386 [097] - 13 - 10.3              Binding Scope This Agreement may be freely assigned by any party, subject to the condition that such assignment shall only become effective upon obtaining the prior written consent of all other parties. The provisions herein shall extend to the benefit of and be enforceable by the original parties as well as their respective successors and assigns. However, each party retains the sole discretion to decide whether or not to enforce the Agreement against any subsequent assignee.
